thread.title: You'll never believe what Mets' Noah Syndergaard looked like in high school (PHOTO)
thread.title_full: You'll never believe what Mets' Noah Syndergaard looked like in high school (PHOTO) | NJ.com

author: Charles Curtis | For NJ Advance Media
title: You'll never believe what Mets' Noah Syndergaard looked like in high school (PHOTO)
text:
Long before Mets rookie phenom Noah Syndergaard was "Thor" and mowed down hitters with 100 MPH stuff , he was a self-proclaimed "chunker" whose realization that he wanted to stop being teased led him to lose weight.
PLUS: Mets' pitching staff isn't getting enough credit this postseason
On Sunday, while the pitcher helped the Mets win Game 2 of the NLCS , Sports Illustrated's Ben Reiter posted this yearbook photo of Syndergaard:
Remember: this guy can now throw 101. Anything is possible. pic.twitter.com/6N6lU7mUdT
â€” Ben Reiter (@SI_BenReiter) October 19, 2015
Deadspin then found this feature in which Syndergaard recounted his weight problems and the bullying that resulted.
"Back in eighth grade I was a chunkster, kids would tease me for being overweight," Syndergaard said in 2012.
He told his father he wanted to work out and eat better. The result? Thanks to that revelation and growth spurt, he's a Norse god.
